item.title: Stop Tracking Files Folders in Git
item.description: Sometimes you accidentally commit and push files or folders (e.g., build/, dist/, public/) that should never be tracked. Later, you want to: Stop tracking them Keep them locally for development/builds Sync your branch cleanly with remote Here’s a safe, step-by-step workflow. Check Branch Status git status You may see: Your branch and 'origin/main' have diverged, and have X and Y different commits each or modified files you don’t want to track.
